item.description:
EVENT DETAILS HAVE BEEN UPDATED (late Tue. night)

We're going to Toad's annual Kooks & Spooks costume party! Drinking, dancing, cool costumes, and a contest! Those who went last year I'm sure will never forget the 10 ft tall demon, the NBC peacock, or Amil sucking on Sascha (photos here!).

Alexis & I will be grabbing a bite around 8-ish so we should get to Toad's around 9-ish. If anyone can get there earlier and would like to take over as contact/host, please let me know. The doors open at 8. Last year the doors opened late, and it was pretty quiet for a while after that before it filled-up and got rocking. The costume contest will happen once it gets full, they think around 10:30/11.

We may try to start by gathering together in the back bar (to the right of the stage).

Perhaps we can all hookup by text message? If you arrive early, at the least, if you text me, I can probably give you the # of an NHCer that is already there.

There are rumors that there may be free passes to be had downtown. Keep a lookout, and if you see any, grab a bunch, I know of at least 8 NHCers that said they wanted to do something on Halloween.

Alexis & I will be leaving Toad's early (11:30?) because we're going to the funky annual Yale midnight Halloween multi-media extravaganza. I posted this as an Event too (read more about it there).

HOST: Jason, cell 203-901-4957. Since it's a noisy place, you might want to try texting me.

POST-PARTY: Nothing says Halloween like going to a diner in costume, and this might even happen.
item.name: Wed 10/31 - Halloween Hi-jinks at Toad's!
